body:
appears to be misleading docs to me:

```python
def setUpModule():
    print(setUpModule.__name__)

def tearDownModule():
    print(tearDownModule.__name__)

def test():
    print(test.__name__)

def test2():
    print(test2.__name__)

```

```
$ pytest -v -s t.py
============================= test session starts ==============================
platform linux -- Python 3.6.5, pytest-3.8.3.dev1+gdf435fa8.d20181002, py-1.6.0, pluggy-0.7.1 -- /tmp/t/venv/bin/python3
cachedir: .pytest_cache
rootdir: /tmp/t, inifile:
collected 2 items                                                              

t.py::test setUpModule
test
PASSED
t.py::test2 test2
PASSEDtearDownModule


=========================== 2 passed in 0.02 seconds ===========================
```

It's even mentioned in the [2.4.0 release](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/master/doc/en/announce/release-2.4.0.rst)!

Looks like this was (erroneously?) introduced in #2656

@flanaman would you like to fix the docs here? :D

> Looks like this was (erroneously?) introduced in #2656

Ooops! Clearly it is supported: https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/df435fa8bd832bafe852e7d2c7bb77713ec429a0/src/_pytest/python.py#L528-L539

What probably happened is that I searched for `"setUpModule"` in `_pytest/unittest.py` when crafting those docs, while this functionality is implemented in `python.py`. :man_facepalming:

I can take care of this. 

This needs to go away from [unittest.rst](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/master/doc/en/unittest.rst#unittesttestcase-support) and from the [website](https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.html#setupmodule-and-teardownmodule). Correct?
Editing the rst is an you need!
@pecey you can even do that from the GitHub web UI directly. ðŸ˜‰
Ah! Will send in a PR.

issue.title: Fixes #4064 by correcting the documentation for unit-tests

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Updated `unittest.rst` with the correct documentation.


Fixes #4064 

(Note: the "fixes #issue" must be in the description, not in the title ðŸ˜‰)

issue.title: setUpModule/tearDownModule not invoked

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
In #4064, on pytest 2.x, it was determined that unittest supported the unittest `setUpModule` and `tearDownModule`.

However, with pytest 8.x, I'm finding that it's not supported, even though the [docs say it is](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/58844247f7ae4a7a213a73c8af2462253b3d8fc7/doc/en/how-to/unittest.rst?plain=1#L28).

In particular, I'm porting CPython's [test_tarfile](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/main/Lib/test/test_tarfile.py) to [backports.tarfile](/jaraco/backports.tarfile). When I run the tests, the setUpModule is never called.

Interestingly, the hook does seem to be honored in a minimized example.

```python
 draft @ cat test_.py
def setUpModule():
    print(setUpModule.__name__)

def tearDownModule():
    print(tearDownModule.__name__)

def test():
    print(test.__name__)

def test2():
    print(test2.__name__)
 draft @ pip-run pytest -- -m pytest -s
============================================================== test session starts ===============================================================
platform darwin -- Python 3.12.2, pytest-8.1.1, pluggy-1.4.0
rootdir: /Users/jaraco/draft
collected 2 items                                                                                                                                

test_.py setUpModule
test
.test2
.tearDownModule


=============================================================== 2 passed in 0.00s ================================================================
```

If on the other hand, I add the following to `conftest.py`, the setup/teardown methods are called:

```python
@pytest.fixture(scope='module', autouse=True)
def setup_and_teardown_module(request):
    request.module.setUpModule()
    try:
        yield
    finally:
        request.module.tearDownModule()
```

But it seems like that should be unnecessary if unittest's setUpMethod and tearDownMethod are supported.
